meanings.definition: Errors in a printed work discovered after printing and shown with corrections.
meanings.sent1: The teacher found several errata in the textbook.
meanings.sent2: The errata sheet listed all the mistakes in the report.
meanings.sent3: The errata in the cookbook made for some interesting cooking adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was full of errata, but she managed to correct them on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The errata in the map led us on a wild goose chase.

meanings.definition: A list of errors in a printed work.
meanings.sent1: He carefully reviewed the errata before submitting his thesis.
meanings.sent2: The errata provided by the editor helped improve the quality of the book.
meanings.sent3: The errata document was accidentally sent to the wrong recipient.
meanings.sent4: The errata resembled a roadmap of mistakes that needed fixing.
meanings.sent5: She diligently checked the errata to ensure the accuracy of the publication.
